text.author: Supreme Court of the United States
text.summary: In a case before the Chief Justice and the Court, it is argued that a 2016 licensing of Warhol's Orange Prince does not infringe the copyright of Ms. Goldsmith, who created the photograph the work was based on, since Warhol added tranformative meaning in accordance with precedent from Campbell and the 4 Factor Test, motivating a reversal of the Second Circuit's prior decision.
text.title: Andy Warhol Found., Inc. v. Goldsmith
